full_text: Screened by NARA, 7/28/2023 SOCIAL SECURITY RESPONSIBILITIES This d vene must be read and signed by persons wishing CO submit an affidavit of sup or schals of an alien applying for an immigrant visa. A signed copy of this doct MUSC be attached CO each copy of any affidavit of support submitted on Dehalf of all applicant. The Social Security ACC, as amended, established certain requirements for determining the eligibility of aliens for Supplemental Security Income (SSI) and Aid to Families with Dependenc Children (AFUC) benefits. These amendments require that the income and resources of any person who as the sponsor of an alten's entry into the United States, executed an affidavit or support or stallar agreement on behalf of the alien, and the income and resources of the sponsor's spouse, shall bu deemed to be one income and resources of the alien under formulas for determining eligibility for SSI and AFDC benefits during the chrus years following the alien's entry inco the United States. The eligibility of aliens for SSI and AFDC will be concingent upon their obtaining the cooperation of their sponsor in providing the necessary information and evidence CO enable the Social Security Administration and State Welfare Agencies CO carry our this provision. All alien applying for SSI or AFDC MUSC make available to the Social Security Administration and/or State Welfare Agency documentation concerning his income or resources of chose of his spensors, including information which he provided in support of his application for an immigrant visa or adjustment of status. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is authorized CO obtain copies of any such documentation from other agencies. The Social Security ACC also provides that an alien and his or her sponsor shall be jointly and severally liable CO repay any SSI and AFDC benefits which are incorrectly paid because of misinformation provided by sponsor or because of sponsor's failure to provide information, and any incorrect payments which are not repaid will be wichheld from any subsequent payments for which the alien or sponsors are otherwise eligible under the Social Security Acc. These provisions do nor apply to allens admitted as refugees or granted political asylua by the Attorney General. They also will apply to the SSI eligibility of uliens who become blind or disabled after entry into che Uniced States. The AFDC provisions do not apply to aliens who are dependent children of the sponsor or sponsor's spouse.
